alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 14 at 6:22PM MST until July 14 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 621 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Picacho to near Arizona City to 8 miles southeast of Chui-Chu, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 185 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 160 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 140. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Toltec, Arizola, Randolph, Blackwater and Stanfield. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
